questionsData.title: The forms of matter are called states.
"ultrasonic" means "beyond sound".
The earth orbits the moon.
Cotton is a kind of material.
A river is bigger than a sea.
"grazing" and "chewing the cud" are the same..
The female of the horse is a "mare".
"diligent" means "lazy".
Knives, pots and jwellery are artifacts.
"plantation" means "dry land".
Irresponsibility is to take charge of something.
"handicapped" are "disabled people".
"hopeless" means "very good".
Offering and giving are synonyms.
"Dear Madam" is a polite way of talking to a lady.
To grill meat is to place it under heat.
Ground ginger is used for building houses.
"stuffing" means "changing the color of something".
"drifting" means "controlled well".
Mystery is something impossible to be explained.
The text is mainly talking about ……….
questionsData.article:
A mountain is a landform that rises high its surroundings. The groups of mountains are called ranges. The
lines of ranges form mountain belts. Some mountains were formed by the activity of volcanoes. Scientists believe
that most volcanic mountains are made of rocks that melted deep with the earth. The rock rose through the earth's
surface, or crust; it then flowed onto the surface in the form of lava. The lava, along with dust, build-up to form
mountains. Volcanic mountains are typically steep and cone shaped. Other mountains were formed by movements
within earth's surface, or crust. Earth's surface is (divided 1) into huge pieces called plates, which (move 2) very
slowly. The continents sit on top of the plates and move with them. At times the plates hit each other, forcing the
rock upward. The Himalayas of Asia are an example of this type of mountain chain. (They 3) were formed when a
plate carrying India was collided with the Asian plate
